actions.text: Final Day of Subcommittee Mark-up.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
The House Committee on Appropriations reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-617, by Mr. Whitten.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 338.
Considered as privileged matter.
Mr. McHugh moved to resolve into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
Pending the foregoing motion, Mr. McHugh asked unanimous consent that the time for general debate on the bill be limited to not to exceed one hour. Agreed to without objection.
On motion to resolve into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union Agreed to by voice vote.
The Speaker designated the Honorable John M. Spratt Jr. to act as Chairman of the Committee.
GENERAL DEBATE - Pursuant to a unanimous consent agreement, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate.
Mr. McHugh moved for the Committee of the Whole to rise and report.
On motion to rise and report Agreed to by voice vote.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 5487.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
The House adopted the remaining amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
Mr. DeLay moved to recommit with instructions to Appropriations.

DEBATE - The House proceeded with ten minutes of debate on the motion to recommit with instructions. The instructions require the bill to be reported back to the House with language removed which imposes a restriction on the expenditure of funds relating to the Food Stamp Program.
On motion to recommit with instructions Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the instructions contained in the motion to recommit, Mr. McHugh reported the bill back to the House and offered the required amendment.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 312 - 99 (Roll no. 250).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Appropriations.
Committee on Appropriations. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Appropriations. Reported to Senate by Senator Bumpers for Senator Burdick with amendments. With written report No. 102-334.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 560.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 2768 proposed by Senator Leahy.
Amendment SP 2768 as modified agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2769 proposed by Senator Graham.
Motion to table SP 2769 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54-41. Record Vote No: 155.
Amendment SP 2770 proposed by Senator McCain.
Amendment SP 2771 proposed by Senator Bentsen to Amendment SP 2770.
Amendment SP 2771 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2770 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2772 proposed by Senator Bumpers for Senator Leahy.
Amendment SP 2772 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2773 proposed by Senator Cochran for Senator Dole.
Amendment SP 2773 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2774 proposed by Senator Cochran for Senator Simpson.
Amendment SP 2774 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2775 proposed by Senator Simon.
Amendment SP 2775 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2776 proposed by Senator Domenici.
Proposed amendment SP 2776 withdrawn in Senate.
Amendment SP 2777 proposed by Senator Boren.
Amendment SP 2777 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2778 proposed by Senator Bryan.
Amendment SP 2779 proposed by Senator Brown.
Amendment SP 2779 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 2780 proposed by Senator Brown.
Amendment SP 2781 proposed by Senator Harkin.
Motion to table SP 2778 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 74-23. Record Vote No: 156.
Motion to table SP 2780 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54-43. Record Vote No: 157.
Proposed amendment SP 2781 withdrawn in Senate.
Passed Senate with amendments by Yea-Nay Vote. 88-9. Record Vote No: 158.
Senate insists on its amendments, asks for a conference, appoints conferees Burdick; Bumpers; Harkin; Adams; Fowler; Kerrey; Byrd; Cochran; Kasten; Specter; Nickles; Bond; Hatfield.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Whitten asked unanimous consent that the House disagree to the Senate amendments, and agree to a conference.
On motion that the House disagree to the Senate amendments, and agree to a conference Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Skeen moved that the House instruct conferees.

DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to instruct conferees on the part of the House to insist on the House position on the Senate amendment No. 43, to reduce by $129,500,000 the amount of funds made available for unsubsidized guaranteed loans under the Rural Housing Insurance Fund Program appropriations.
On motion that the House instruct conferees Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The Speaker appointed conferees: Whitten, Traxler, McHugh, Natcher, Durbin, Kaptur, Price, Mrazek, Smith (IA), Skeen, Myers, Weber, Vucanovich, and McDade.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate.

Mr. Natcher asked unanimous consent that managers on the part of the House have until midnight on Aug. 6 to file a conference report on H.R. 5487, making appropriations for Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration.  Agreed to without objection.
Conferees agreed to file conference report.

Mr. Durbin asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Appropriations have until midnight on Aug. 7 to file a report on H.R. 5487, making appropriations for Agriculture, Rural Development. Agreed to without objection.
Conference report H. Rept. 102-815 filed with 34 amendments in disagreement.
Mr. McHugh brought up conference report H. Rept. 102-815 by previously agreed to special order.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of general debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the conference report Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 299 - 100 (Roll no. 379).
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 2.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 2 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 4.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

Mr. McHugh asked unanimous consent to consider enbloc the Senate amendments Nos. 6, 17, 23, 27, 46, 59, 72, 83, 102, 105 and 114. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur in the Senate amendments en bloc.

The previous question was ordered without objection.

Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 18.

The previous question was ordered without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 24.
On motion that the House recede and concur in the Senate amendment No. 21 Agreed to by voice vote.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 24 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 35.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 47.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 35 Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 67.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 47 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 69.

DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On motion that the House recede and concur in the Senate amendment No. 73 Agreed to by voice vote.

On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 74 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 80.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 98.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 80 Agreed to without objection.

Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 119.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 119 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. McHugh moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 120.
Motions to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 120 Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Conference papers: Senate report and managers' statement and message on House action held at the desk in Senate.
Senate agreed to conference report by Voice Vote.
Senate agreed to House amendment to Senate amendments number 2, 4, 7, 8, 15, 16, 18, 19, 24, 35, 47, 67, 69, 74, 80, 98, 99, 101, 106, 119, and 120 by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-341.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Rural Development, Agriculture and Related Agencies

official_title: Making appropriations for Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1993, and for other purposes.
short_title: Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1993
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services
Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.as: House receded and concurred with amendment
summary.text: Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1993 - Title I: Agricultural Programs - Appropriates funds for FY 1993 for the following programs and services: (1) Office of the Secretary of Agriculture; (2) Office of the Deputy Secretary of Agriculture; (3) Office of Budget and Program Analysis; (4) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Administration; (5) Departmental Administration; (6) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Congressional Relations; (7) Office of Public Affairs; (8) Office of the Inspector General; (9) Office of the General Counsel; (10) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Economics; (11) Economic Research Service; (12) National Agricultural Statistics Service; (13) World Agricultural Outlook Board; (14) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Science and Education; (15) Agricultural Research Service; (16) Cooperative State Research Service; (17) Extension Service; (18) National Agricultural Library; (19) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Marketing and Inspection Services; (20) Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service; (21) Food Safety and Inspection Service; (22) Federal Grain Inspection Service; (23) Agricultural Cooperative Service; (24) Agricultural Marketing Service; (25) Packers and Stockyards Administration; (26) Office of the Under Secretary for International Affairs and Commodity Programs; (27) Agricultural Stabilization and Conservation Service; (28) Federal Crop Insurance Corporation; and (29) Commodity Credit Corporation Fund. Title II: Conservation Programs - Appropriates funds for: (1) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Natural Resources and Environment; (2) Soil Conservation Service; and (3) Agricultural Stabilization and Conservation Service. Title III: Farmers Home and Rural Development Programs - Appropriates funds for: (1) Office of the Under Secretary for Small Community and Rural Development; (2) Farmers Home Administration; (3) Rural Electrification Administration; and (4) Rural Development Administration. Title IV: Domestic Food Programs - Appropriates funds for: (1) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Food and Consumer Services; (2) Food and Nutrition Service, including the Food Stamp Program; and (3) Human Nutrition Information Service. Title V: Foreign Assistance and Related Programs - Appropriates funds for: (1) Foreign Agricultural Service; (2) Public Law 480 Program Account; and (3) Office of International Cooperation and Development. Title VI: Related Agencies and Food and Drug Administration - Appropriates funds for: (1) Food and Drug Administration; (2) Farm Credit System Financial Assistance Corporation; (3) Commodity Futures Trading Commission; and (4) Farm Credit Administration. Title VII: General Provisions - Specifies certain uses and limits on or prohibitions against the use of funds appropriated by this Act. Prohibits the use of funds made available by this Act to carry out: (1) a Market Promotion Program in excess of specified limits; or (2) the Agricultural Resource Conservation Demonstration Program. Prohibits the use of funds made available by this Act to enroll additional Wetlands Reserve Program or Conservation Reserve Program acres.
